newsitem.title: BULGARIA: BULGARIA IMPOSES MINIMAL FOOD EXPORT PRICES.
newsitem.headline: BULGARIA IMPOSES MINIMAL FOOD EXPORT PRICES.

text.p: Bulgaria imposed new minimum export prices on pork, chicken meat and cheese in a bid to prevent price deregulation caused by the devaluation of the local currency, the trade minister said on Wednesday.
"The trade ministry decided to impose minimum export prices after we found out that many exporters had artificially lowered prices," Atanas Paparisov told a news conference.

The minimum export prices, being enforced from September, are as follows: pork - 1,150/1,450 dollars per tonne, chicken meet - 1,000 dollars per tonne. Cheese prices range between 1,200 to 3,600 dollars per tonne depending on the sort.
The prices will coem in force after the trade ministry's decree is published in the State Gazette. -- Sofia Newsroom, 359-2-84561
